Okay find, but it's not quite sure in that pic if it is actually a Garg.

I also found a Yorp in the game "Within A Deep Forest"! Might make a screenshot of that.____________

Don't know that game DaVince, but would like to see a screenshot of that yorp.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: ooh
content: "Within a Deep Forest" is the first of a few games released by Nifflas... you can download them [url=http://nifflas.ni2.se/index.php?main=01Home]here[/url]. They're cute little games focussed on exploration and atmosphere. Very inspiring as far as "simple graphics for big impact" go... I wish I could make scenery that well.

title: Re: ooh
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]"Within a Deep Forest" is the first of a few games released by Nifflas...[hr][/quote]
Oh no it isn't. Go to the fansite and you'll find his older games, like #Modarchive Story and The Turtle Philosopher. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[url=http://yaaay.net/niffpage/]yaaay.net/niffpage/[/url]

title: Re: ooh
content:
For me, Within a Deep Forest was really a masterpiece. Knytt also has its points and was interesting. But Knytt stories... It is just more uninteresting, boring and easier levels of Knytt and nothing more. The magic is gone.----

title: Yorp Yorp Yorp!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]New enemies[hr][/quote]
Actually, there were almost none in the old game, giving the game pretty much a change of gameplay. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] I actually find it not-boring now, funny how people's experiences and opinions can differ sometimes.

Okay, here I found Yorp #1, floating around in a space ship, harming you and stuff.

[img]http://www.tengusoft.net/davince/images/yorp1.png[/img]

Yorp #2 (an eye sticking out of the ground in the first ice cave) is difficuly to reach, so I might screen that later. Or not, go play the game yourself. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Yorp Yorp Yorp!
content:
Well I have to admit that "An underwater adventure" was a pretty good one. For me it was the most interesting, atmospheric and enjoyable episode from the new ones. The only minus was the lack of dialogs. And "Gustav's daughter" wasn't bad, especially (and only) the cave part with those very hard jumping obstacles. All the other episodes got some interesting elements in them, but overall... naah. Maybe I should download some other episodes. If you can recommend one?----

[img]http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/1923/untitled116qa.gif[/img]
Tough Bloogs eat princesses
